caption_original:
All aboard! üöä The cultural heart of Glacier National Park, Rogers Pass NHS Mount Revelstoke and Glacier national parks, offers a unique history of the Canadian Pacific Railway Company, and is a beautiful spot to explore for those who ‚ù§Ô∏è to ski. 

But wait‚Ä¶ Make sure not to forget your Winter Permit! #DYK? Glacier National Park is home to the world‚Äôs largest mobile avalanche control program! Together with the Canadian Armed Forces, Parks Canada conducts avalanche control with artillery to ensure safety of transportation throughout the park, resulting in daily openings and closures. In order to ski in this area, visitors must take part in the Winter Permit System. Learn more about how you can get your permit here: http://ow.ly/Vmnu30gV6eW

To celebrate #Canada150, we're featuring ALL of our 200+ places across our social media accounts. Stay tuned!

caption_original: In approximately 30 locations across Ivvavik National Park, Parks Canada installs weatherproof motion-triggered wildlife cameras. Resource Conservation Officers primarily use this data to monitor grizzly bear activity in the park, especially during the caribou migration, and to learn what other animals may be active in the area.
